perturbation.original_text: In connection with any Offering, the Seller Trusts shall instruct the placement agents or underwriters to use their reasonable best efforts to (i) effect as wide a distribution of the Shares as is reasonably practicable without adversely affecting the pricing thereof and (ii) not sell any Shares to any person or Group (as such terms is used in Section 13(d)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act")) who, upon completion of the Offering, would have Beneficial Ownership (as defined in Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act) of shares of Common Stock representing in the aggregate 5.0% or more the total number of outstanding shares of Common Stock (or in the case of a person of the type described in Rule 13d-1(b)(1)(i) under the Exchange Act, 10% or more of the Total Voting Power).
perturbation.changed_text: In connection with any Offering, the Seller Trusts may consider instructing the placement agents or underwriters to use efforts to (i) effect a distribution of the Shares and (ii) sell Shares to persons or Groups as they see fit.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for 'reasonable best efforts' to effect a wide distribution and to avoid selling to entities that would exceed ownership thresholds. This omission introduces a legal contradiction because securities laws prioritize fair and wide distribution to prevent market manipulation and ensure transparency, particularly in offerings. By weakening these requirements, the contract increases the risk of insider trading and concentrated ownership, violating securities regulations.

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Parties hereto agrees that a judgment in any such dispute may be enforced in other jurisdictions by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by law. - 6 - EACH PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT HEREBY WAIVES, AND AGREES TO CAUSE ITS AFFILIATES TO WAIVE, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, ANY RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY OF ANY CLAIM, DEMAND, ACTION OR CAUSE OF ACTION (A) ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT OR (B) IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH OR RELATED OR INCIDENTAL TO THE DEALINGS OF THE PARTIES HERETO IN RESPECT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY OF THE TRANSACTIONS RELATED HERETO, IN EACH CASE WHETHER NOW EXISTING OR HEREAFTER ARISING, AND WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, EQUITY OR OTHERWISE.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Parties hereto agrees that a judgment in any such dispute may be enforced in other jurisdictions. - 6 - EACH PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT HEREBY WAIVES ANY RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY OF ANY CLAIM, DEMAND, ACTION OR CAUSE OF ACTION (A) ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT OR (B) IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH OR RELATED OR INCIDENTAL TO THE DEALINGS OF THE PARTIES HERETO IN RESPECT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY OF THE TRANSACTIONS RELATED HERETO, IN EACH CASE WHETHER NOW EXISTING OR HEREAFTER ARISING, AND WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, EQUITY OR OTHERWISE.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, AND AGREES TO CAUSE ITS AFFILIATES TO WAIVE' is removed, weakening the jury waiver. While jury waivers are generally enforceable, they are scrutinized and must be knowing and voluntary. By removing the 'fullest extent permitted by law' and 'cause its affiliates to waive' phrasing, the contract creates ambiguity and potential grounds for challenging the waiver's validity. This contradicts the legal principle of ensuring waivers are clear, unambiguous, and fully informed, introducing legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 7th Amendment to the United States Constitution

perturbation.original_text: 4.10 Certain Representations of the Parties. Each of the Parties hereto represents, several and not jointly, that it has taken all action required of it to duly authorize this OMA and that no further action or approval is required on its behalf and, when executed and delivered, this OMA constitutes a valid and binding obligation of such Party, enforceable in accordance with its terms.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.10 Certain Representations of the Parties. Each of the Parties hereto represents that it has taken action to authorize this OMA and that when executed and delivered, this OMA constitutes an obligation of that Party.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'several and not jointly,' 'no further action or approval is required on its behalf,' and 'valid and binding' weakens the representations. The parties no longer explicitly represent they are individually authorized and fully compliant, or that the agreement is binding under its terms. This omission could create uncertainty about each party's authority and obligations, potentially violating contract law principles requiring clear mutual assent and enforceability. It omits a critical requirement of a contract.
